title: Dolphin shorts
text:
Dolphin shorts or Dolfins are a specific style of unisex <a href="shorts">shorts</a> for <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a>. They are typically very short and were originally made from nylon with contrasting binding, side slits, and rounded corners, with a <a href="waistband">waistband</a> at the top—a style popular in the 1980s.
The name is from <a href="Dolfin%20Swimwear">Dolfin</a>, the American company that first produced this style of shorts in the 1980s. Due to their shortness, they are sometimes identified as a form of <a href="hotpants">hotpants</a>.
One high-profile wearer of "dolphin shorts" is <a href="Richard%20Simmons">Richard Simmons</a>, who boasted of owning 400 pairs of vintage Dolfins in 2012.
Orange Dolfin shorts are specified as part of the uniform for waitresses at <a href="Hooters">Hooters</a>.
